titleInfo.title: McKinley High School Oral History Project: Old South Baton Rouge Social Organizations
titleInfo.subTitle: Lorri A. Burgess oral history interview, 2002

name.description: Lorri Burgess was born in Baton Rouge, La., in 1963. She attended elementary and high school in South Baton Rouge, graduated from Louisiana State University in 1986, and then completed the paralegal studies program at LSU. She won her first election in 1996 and served three terms as the Metropolitan Councilwoman for District 10. Burgess was Baton Rouge's first elected African-American Mayor Pro-Tempore. The many organizations with which she has been involved include the Baton Rouge Center for World Affairs, the Greater Baton Rouge Port Commission, YWCA Encore Plus, the Sickle Cell Anemia Foundation, Sisters Supporting Sisters, and the McKinley High Alumni Association.
